page.title: 05LYME LANDSLIP - INFORMATION
page.content: The grass and mud overlie rocks formed in the JURASSIC period, over two hundred million years old. There are three main bands of rock, 1.Blue Lias, 2.Black Ven and 3.Belemnite Marls overlain by cretaceous sandstone. Land Use The Western half of the landslip area (Spittles) is mainly meadow (7 meadows), used for grazing young cattle. The central area of Black Ven has no land use except for habouring many different species of life. The remains of the Lyme to Charmouth road is now used as a round walk. There is a plantation of conifers at Timber Hill and the grass is unimproved (has not been treated with insecticides etc) which means that life flourishes here i.e. growth of wild flowers attracts - butterflies,deer, badgers etc may also be found here.
